Description: THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FUNDS TO NORTH CENTRAL REGIONAL WATER DISTRICT FOR THE PLANNING AND DESIGN OF THE NORTH CENTRAL REGIONAL WATER SYSTEM. THE WATER SYSTEMS SERVING RESIDENTS OF NORTH CENTRAL MONTANA DO NOT MEET MINIMUM HEALTH AND SAFETY STANDARDS, POSE A THREAT TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY, AND ARE INADEQUATE TO SUPPLY THE WATER NEEDS OF THE RESIDENTS. FURTHER, THE ENTITIES ADMINISTERING THE RURAL AND MUNICIPAL WATER SYSTEMS IN NORTH CENTRAL MONTANA ARE HAVING DIFFICULTY COMPLYING WITH REGULATIONS PROMULGATED UNDER THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (42 U.S.C. 300F ET SEQ.). CONGRESS PASSED PUBLIC LAW 107-331 TO ADDRESS THE WATER SUPPLY ISSUE IN NORTH CENTRAL MONTANA.THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PLAN, DESIGN, AND CONSTRUCT THE NORTH CENTRAL MONTANA REGIONAL WATER SYSTEM TO ENSURE A SAFE AND ADEQUATE RURAL, MUNICIPAL, AND INDUSTRIAL WATER SUPPLY FOR RESIDENTS OF CHOUTEAU, GLACIER, HILL, LIBERTY, PONDERA, TETON, AND TOOLE COUNTIES, MONTANA.
